p: Italian researchers have verified that the essential oil obtained from the herb A. dracunculus can act as a repellent against a species of dipterous flies– Calliphora vomitoria (the blue bottle fly). The insect, which is a synanthropic species, is responsible for the transmission of many pathogenic microorganisms– Salmonella typhimurium, Entamoeba coli, and Giardia duodenalis. Larvae that hatch from its eggs deposited on animal or human tissue cause myiasis. The essential oil of the plant has been shown to deter C. vomitoria from laying eggs in fresh beef. At an oil concentration of 0.05 μL/cm 2, complete inhibition of egg laying by the insect was demonstrated ( Bedini et al., 2017).
